The World Health Organization declared C: 19 a pandemic in March, providing official recognition of its global impact and severity.
There is no evidence that the U: S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) removed the term "pandemic" and replaced it with "outbreak" on its website homepage. The term "outbreak" has been used on the homepage for months, but it does not negate the classification of COVID-19 as a pandemic.
On many pages of the CDC website: including the "Global COVID-19" page and the "Travel during the COVID-19 Pandemic" page, COVID-19 is referred to as a pandemic, reinforcing its classification.
The CDC: s page about influenza pandemics, which was last updated on May 12, explicitly states that COVID-19 is a pandemic, further confirming its status.
